QuestionJSON.Question:
Chile is designing an application that uses real-time data to inform users about the air quality in their immediate vicinity. Chile's program has an array of air samples taken every hour for a week. Here is a snippet of Chile's code:Which of the following provides the correct explanation for how Chile's code executes when an 'unhealthy' reading is detected?

1integer i = 0
2while i < length of airSamples
3
if airSamples[i] == 'unhealthy'
4
output 'The air quality is currently unhealthy. Please take appropriate precautions.'
5
end
6
i = i + 1
7end
QuestionJSON.Answer1: This code will print the unhealthy air quality message once and then stop the program.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: This code will print the unheathy air quality message each time the word 'unhealthy' is the array value.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: This code will ignore the unhealthy air quality readings.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: This code will only send a notification to the user if the air quality has been unhealthy for a week.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: The loop in Chile's code executes once every hour, checking the air quality each time. If an 'unhealthy' reading is detected, it will trigger an event that sends a notification to the user. This will continue to occur every hour as long as the air quality remains 'unhealthy'.
QuestionJSON.Code_Snippet:
1integer i = 0
2while i < length of airSamples
3
if airSamples[i] == 'unhealthy'
4
output 'The air quality is currently unhealthy. Please take appropriate precautions.'
5
end
6
i = i + 1
7end
